content.description: This is a very good climb, definitely worth trekking out. Though you will have to schlep quite a few pads out to feel safe, the climb is about 20' without the small additional finish. The extension finish adds a few very spicy moves up high, go get it!  Start on two small crimps in a rail with a good foot, move towards the big pocket jug halfway up, get very high feet and surge up to the not so good pocket finish.
content.protection: Quite a few pads and gumption

content.description: Start with your feet smearing laybacking/jamming on a good sidepull. Continue the layback to a thought-provoking top off. Make sure your spotter is attentive don't want a spill into the rusty pipe.
content.location: Look for the triangle gem, it is just down from this on the climbers left side.

content.description:
Other than the very start of the route the quality is great. The climb is delicate, and balancy, much like A Kiss from A  Rose. The crux is low, but the headpoint crux is high up, balancing on small holds making large moves and leaving feet behind will definitely give you the thrill you are looking for. When you reach the routes namesake at 20ft trnd left for the easier line. Trending right takes you I am your man.

 It would be wise to top rope before making a go of it, especially if there is no chalk.
content.location: Middle of cliff, near the 12+ line.

content.description: The crux is down low, after pulling on there is a long move to some thuggy campusing or you can hope the heel holds and heel around the arete. If you do this make sure there are lots of pads and spotters. A fall uncontrolled could be very dangerous. Start on two decent pockets on the left of the arete, make a big move to a small iron band, jump up to a jug and ride the arete on up.
content.location: The start is up on a ledge near a large cave with no developed lines.

content.description: Crux is topping the route, the climbing up to the top is terrific!
content.location: Follow the arching layback up to the final roof.

content.description: The crux may be getting into the crack. The crack needs cleaned up before the send.
content.protection: Passive nuts work well, some finger/hand cams will work also. Top out & rappel from tree.
content.location: The route is to climbers right of the "sport" route. This is the furthest obvious crack of the three on the roof feature.

content.description: Generic area, access to be added.
